alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 26 at 2:31PM MST until February 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WEEKEND SNOW... .Snow will return to the mountains tonight with the arrival of the first of a series of systems to the region. Snow intensity will increase late tonight before waning early Sunday afternoon. A stronger system with heavier snow amounts will arrive late Sunday into Monday. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 10 and 15 inches possible above 3000 feet. Less than two inches of snow accumulation below 3000 feet before it turns to rain Monday. * WHERE...Eastport and Schweitzer Mountain Road. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible in the mountains.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
